title: Is there any scientific evidence to back up the effects of star signs on personality? - Quora

response.answer_text: My daughter just had her birthday this past week. My birthday is in July. I had to explain to her that she was lucky to have hers during the school year because her teacher could wish her a happy birthday and because we were able to invite her friends to a “drive-by” birthday party (COVID-19 for the loss). I am also reminded that our month of birth, to some degree, dictates when we get to start our first year of school. My daughter missed the cutoff to start a year earlier by only a few weeks (the district doesn’t let you do a waiver). Thus, I could maybe argue that your birth date may have some very vague influence upon your personality. That has nothing to do with stars, though. Correlation isn’t causation. A celestial body that is so far away that our minds aren’t capable of fathoming the distance isn’t really possible. In fact, they aren’t even where we see them anymore. We’re receiving light from a body that is quite far away. Cassiopeia is 4,000 light years away. Who knows what it looks like right now? The belief that stars affect us in any way is romantic prattle. It’s cute for poets to take about it, but it’s nothing more than that.

“Signs of the Zodiac” do not affect anything, rather the reflect a person’s nature based upon natural order in the universe that aligns with, well, everything!… including our coming into being. By asking about “scientific evidence” this presumes that science is the supreme measuring stick of all in life. This of course is a misguided notion, for example, how did science do in anticipating the dying state of the planet? And what solutions, real solutions, are being offered even after their gross mis-perceptions have come to light? While most sciences bear a relationship to “physics” —which even that science is screwing up by mostly ignoring the most important cutting edge areas of physics referred to as ‘quantum physics’, given it collides with some of their outdated and conservative views— Astrology pertains to “metaphysics”. While metaphysics fully accepts and understands the nature and limits of physics, physics cannot even understand metaphysics, as their closed systems do not see beyond their borders. What scientific evidence there is, and has been for many years, relative to all matters of metaphysics, is negated for various reasons that protect the borders science maintains on its reach.
